item.title: Covid travel: France no longer amber-plus as green list expands
item.description: Germany, Austria and Norway move to the green list under changes to the travel traffic light system.

item.title: Covid: Fifth of England hospital admissions aged 18-34
item.description: The new NHS chief executive urges unvaccinated young adults to get jabbed, saying it is "so important".

item.title: How a fake network pushes pro-China propaganda
item.description: The web of 350 fake social media profiles aims to discredit the West, sometimes with garish cartoons.

item.title: Logan Mwangi: Three charged after boy's Bridgend river death
item.description: Logan Mwangi, also known as Logan Williamson, was found in the Ogmore River on Saturday.

item.title: Nearly a third of waking hours spent on TV and streaming, Ofcom says
item.description: Older people have been watching more linear TV while on-demand is a big hit with younger audiences.

item.title: Pret, McColls and Welcome Break in minimum wage fail
item.description: Retailers and 190 other businesses broke the law by underpaying workers, the government says.

item.title: Euro 2020 racist abuse - 11 people arrested
item.description: Hundreds of racist messages were reported following England's defeat and police inquiries continue.

item.title: Marcus Rashford: Poor families missing out on food vouchers
item.description: The footballer says health professionals need to do more to raise awareness about the NHS scheme.

item.title: Government accused of 'burying' conversion therapy report
item.description: Boris Johnson vowed to ban the "abhorrent" practice - but an official report on it has yet to appear.

item.title: TikTok tests Snapchat-like 24-hour feature, say reports
item.description: The reports come as Facebook's WhatsApp starts to roll out a disappearing photos and videos feature.

item.title: Farm pesticides killing more bees - study
item.description: Commercial formulas containing multiple chemicals should require their own licences, researchers say.

item.title: Mexico sues US gun manufacturers over arms trafficking
item.description: The lawsuit accuses companies of fuelling bloodshed through negligent business practices.

item.title: The Papers: 'French reconnection' and 'Sky on a high'
item.description: Thursday's front pages focus on the changes to Covid travel rules and celebrate skateboarder Sky Brown's Olympic success.

item.title: Munchausen by Internet: Are chronic illness influencers really faking it?
item.description: Munchausen by Internet: Are some influencers faking illnesses for fame, money and attention?

item.title: Scotland's colourful marine life
item.description: Scuba-diver Ross McLaren has taken thousands of photos of marine life in Scotland's rivers and sea-lochs.

item.title: Becoming Tina Turner in London's West End
item.description: Aisha Jawando takes over from Adrienne Warren in the title role in the musical Tina.

item.title: Four-year-old US piano prodigy flourishing amid pandemic
item.description: Brigitte's parents just wanted to keep her busy. Now, she's been invited to play at Carnegie Hall.

item.title: Special educational needs: 'My battle to get an equal education'
item.description: Claude created a petition to try to stop other young people having to go through what he has.

item.title: Toxteth boy, 14, cleans up fly-tipping spot and designs community garden
item.description: Khan, 14, wants to turn an area being used as a dumping ground into a public garden and allotment.

item.title: Why whales in Alaska have been so happy
item.description: What will happen to Alaska's whales when tourism returns to waters stilled by Covid?

item.title: Simone Biles 'shows how much gymnastics has changed'
item.description: Biles' withdrawal shows how attitudes have changed, says former USA gymnast Dominique Moceanu.

item.title: Plain sailing: Boating holidays on the rise across the UK
item.description: More people are hiring boats to travel along the UK's canals and rivers amid travel restrictions.

item.title: 'I run my business from my pimped-up camper van'
item.description: Liam Chester was burnt out with work so he converted a camper van to take his office into nature.

item.title: Jack Antonoff has redefined pop music. Here's how
item.description: Taylor Swift, Lana Del Rey and Lorde all rely on his advice. Now he's making a statement of his own.

item.title: BA flight 149: Was it on a secret 'military intelligence mission'?
item.description: Passengers and crew were taken hostage by Iraq when the flight landed in Kuwait in 1990.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics sparks anti-LGBT slurs on Russian TV
item.description: Gay and transgender athletes in Tokyo have been singled out for abuse on Russian state television.

item.title: Sibley & Lawrence out of their depth - Vaughan after England collapse against India
item.description: England batters Dom Sibley and Dan Lawrence are "out of their depth" in Test cricket, says former captain Michael Vaughan.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Liam Heath wins bronze in men's 200m kayak final
item.description: Great Britain's Liam Heath recovers from a bad start to claim bronze in a photo finish in the men's 200m kayak final at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: 'You're not gay, you've had girlfriends' - non-league boss Morton discusses coming out
item.description: As his team gets ready to play in the FA Cup extra preliminary round, Thetford Town player-manager Matt Morton speaks about how he came out to his team-mates.

item.title: Leicester's Fofana suffers bad leg injury in friendly
item.description: Leicester defender Wesley Fofana suffers a nasty looking leg injury in their pre-season friendly with Villarreal.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Dina Asher-Smith returns as GB qualify for 4x100m relay final
item.description: Watch Dina Asher-Smith return to action as she helps GB qualify for the 4x100m relay final after being forced to withdraw from the individual 200m because of injury.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Australia's Kieran Woolley crashes into cameraman in men's park preliminaries
item.description: Australia's Kieran Woolley crashes into a cameraman during the skateboarding men's park preliminaries at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Rugby League World Cup set to be postponed until 2022
item.description: The Rugby League World Cup is set to be postponed until 2022 following the withdrawal of defending champions Australia, and New Zealand.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Asher-Smith returns as GB set new record to reach the 4x100m relay final
item.description: Dina Asher-Smith returns as Great Britain set a new national record to reach the women's 4x100m relay final.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Hector Pardoe pulls out of marathon swim after eye hit by elbow
item.description: Great Britain's Hector Pardoe says he pulled out of the Tokyo Olympics marathon swim after being hit in the eye by an elbow during the race.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Keegan Palmer wins first men's park skateboarding gold
item.description: Australian 18-year-old Keegan Palmer wins gold in the first Olympic men's park skateboarding final at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Britain's Liam Heath claims bronze in men's kayak single 200m
item.description: Great Britain's Liam Heath claims a bronze medal after a "hesitant start" to the defence of his Olympic men's kayak single 200m.

item.title: Peter Bol: The Sudanese-Australian runner who lifted a nation
item.description: Peter Bol's Olympics has delighted Australians, becoming a "symbol of what we can aspire to be".

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Day-by-day guide to the key events, big stars and British medal hopes
item.description: Want to know what's happening when in Tokyo? Check out our comprehensive guide to all the action in Japan.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Liverpool millionaire aiding GB's medal haul
item.description: Barrie Wells sponsored Olympic silver medallist Keely Hodgkinson after she failed to get funding.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Watch the best tricks from the skateboarding park featuring GB's Sky Brown
item.description: Watch the best tricks from the first ever women's park including action from GB's bronze medallist Sky Brown.

item.title: Bronze medallist Brown makes Olympic history
item.description: Sky Brown wins bronze in the women's park skateboarding final at the Tokyo Games, making the 13-year-old Great Britain's youngest Olympic medallist of all time.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: TikTok becomes the unofficial behind-the-scenes Olympic channel
item.description: The short-form video platform is giving fans unprecedented insight into the athletes' experience.

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government has updated its red, amber and green lists of countries.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: Covid: Who is now due to get the vaccine?
item.description: More teenagers will be able to receive the Covid vaccine, and a third jab will soon be available for the most vulnerable.

item.title: Covid rules: What has changed?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The government is expected to announce that 16 and 17-year-olds will receive the Covid vaccine.

item.title: Covid: What are the social distancing rules in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland?
item.description: Social distancing rules are changing across the UK.

item.title: ‘Covid passports’: How to get the NHS Covid Pass
item.description: People in England can use the pass for travel and to visit venues which ask for them.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does the NHS test-and-trace system and app work?
item.description: A record number of alerts are being sent by the NHS Covid app.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: What are the Delta, Gamma, Beta and Alpha Covid variants?
item.description: UK coronavirus cases are rising due to a variant first identified in India that spreads more easily.

item.title: Lockdown muscle loss: Five ways to get back in shape
item.description: Lockdown inactivity may have left people with weaker muscles - there are simple solutions.
